title: Love Island's Amber Gill slams ex Greg O'Shea for not apologising for text dumping
text:

Love Island's Amber Gill has thrown more shade at her ex Greg O'Shea.

The Love Island winner admitted she was shocked her former flame hasn't reached out to her to apologise for brutally dumping her via text.

Feisty TV personality Amber admitted she wasn't holding her breath anymore for the Irish hunk to say sorry.

Amber also revealed the exes no longer speak but she insisted she has "forgotten" about the cruel dumping and "moved on".

She told The Sun : "He hasn't reached out and he hasn't said sorry. Nothing has been said, but I'm not waiting.

(Image: ITV)

"He can crack on with what he wants to do, I'm not waiting for nothing! It's been and gone now.

"I've forgotten about it and moved on. An apology would have been nice at the time, but I didn't get one. It's fine, it doesn't matter. I don't think I'll ever get one. I won't hold out for that."

The Mirror has approached Greg O'Shea's representatives for further comment.

(Image: S Meddle/ITV/REX)

Amber has been focusing on her career as she puts her heartache behind her.

Greg cooled things off with Amber by dumping him over text.

The Irish hunk set out the dumping happened over a couple of days which included a phone call.

(Image: Instagram)

Fans demanded Greg gave Amber his share of the £50K prize fund after he was only with the beauty in the Love Island villa for two weeks.

Greg and Amber were crowned the winners of Love Island 2019 because of her journey in the villa.

Viewers fell in love with Amber as they watched her overcome her heartache after her split from Michael Griffiths.

They were wooed by Greg's Irish charm, only for him to pie off Amber shortly after leaving the villa.

Amber had made her feelings known to Greg as she told him she loved him and she even mused on the idea of moving to his hometown in Ireland.

However, the Love Island hunk said their relationship simply didn't work because of the distance.
